qas.question: What people live in the southeast area of the country?
How are they different than most Tajiks?
What mountians do the Pamiri people call home?

plausible_answers.text: The Pamiri people of Gorno-Badakhshan Autonomous Province in the southeast, bordering Afghanistan

qas.question: What people are not distinct linguistically and culturally from most Tajiks?
Who follows the Ismali sect of Ireland?
What group has not preserved any cultural traditions?
What group speaks a number of Western Iranian languages?

context: <a0_0><b3_0>The Pamiri people<a0_0/> of Gorno-Badakhshan Autonomous Province in the southeast, bordering Afghanistan<b3_0/> and China, though considered part of the Tajik ethnicity, nevertheless are <a1_0>distinct linguistically and culturally<a1_0/> from most Tajiks. In contrast to the mostly Sunni Muslim residents of the rest of Tajikistan, <b4_0><b5_0><b6_0>the Pamiris<b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/> overwhelmingly follow the Ismaili sect of Islam, and speak a number of Eastern Iranian languages, including Shughni, Rushani, Khufi and Wakhi. Isolated in the highest parts of the <a2_0>Pamir Mountains<a2_0/>, they have preserved many ancient cultural traditions and folk arts that have been largely lost elsewhere in the country.
